text: <@UGFURDXD4> i think you are right, that should be the best way
Does it support attachments over email?

depends to what level. You can always create a HubSpot app and either:

• listen to webhooks through that
• make a new action to add to your workflow
the documentation refers to the action "webhook url" in workflows I believe

Hello,
Does anyone know of an up to date C# .Net API Wrapper that I could use?
Thanks
<@U01967KBSQJ> Not sure that there is a C# sdk, i’m only sure there is a PHP <@UFBNA9K9A>?
OK, thanks. That's a shame. The one I am looking at currently was done in 2018 and I cant get it to work, thinking parts have changed

Currently we only support Node.js, Python, Ruby and PHP.  I did a <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/forums/searchpage/tab/message?advanced=false&allow_punctuation=false&q=c%23|quick search> on our ideas forum and it doesn’t look like people are requesting it all that often. If you know others who are also looking looking for support for the “microsoft stack” I would love to hear from them and start collecting numbers to see if we can divert some resources to supporting you all there
ok perfect, thanks for your response. I will see who else is out there

Hi team! I'm a director for a large IT MSP in the states. We are trying to connect ConnectWise and HubSpot. We have a way of syncing company and contact data both in one-way and two-way sync, but we have not found a way to sync deals from HubSpot to Opportunities in ConnectWise. I was told my best bet was this API group. Does anyone have any ideas?
Like contact or company the api have a deal endpoint <@U01F49U8BSL>
Sorry I am not following what you said. Could you rephrase, please?
Highly unlikely. My take on "calculated" is that we do not store it, and we make the value during outbound serialization of the stored data.

It is somewhat hard to comment in detail with only test data but my quick review would indicate one of the submitted values is probably somehow "bad". That's the usual cause of "cannot construct instance of X" in my experience.
This is what <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties> is for
Propbably only <https://github.com/HubSpot-net/HubSpot.NET>

We need to get quite a bit more context to respond here.

I create Deals in HubSpot all day long with APIs and it works great

But we are not necessarily ConnectWise experts whatsoever here, so you have to explain what you tried and what went wrong and what APIs they have etc
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
That's what Quentin is saying
And I asked the same question as him
Lots more detail needed
There is supposedly a way to make yourself an OAuth app and get a webhook in non Enterprise
But I have not attempted this because I needed Sales Enterprise for some other stuff to work for me
There is deliberately no workaround, <@UFBNA9K9A> posted the security reasons why in the channel recently
Then you should be good to go
That key can do whatever you need

You could use the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form|Form Submissions API> but that of course submits a form which may or may not be desirable for your use case. The <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1604069313466500|original post> that Matt is referring to

<@U9SDG59T7> I’m interested in how this works.  Is each user installing the app?  I was under the impression the app is installed once by an installer-user, since one install lets CRM cards show up for all users in that instance.  Is there a fronting webpage at work here?

There's a separate app that queries and shows HubSpot data based on the proper permissions, that's why it's critical that each user installs the app and has their own token, otherwise all records will be accesible to all users.
one ring to rule them all
<@UFBNA9K9A>?
We are actually getting ready for an alpha test of the next version of the Forms API so stayed tune. This can last anywhere from weeks to months depending on how many bugs they find in the alpha

Hey HubSpot team- is there a supported endpoint for uploading and attaching files to CRM objects? all of the file-related endpoints documentation points to CMS, but when we attach files to a CRM object, the Network tab is showing a similar “filemanager” endpoint being used by the Frontend.

<@U01F49U8BSL> Funny, I’m literally inside CWise right now crafting some API requests for invoice creation, not Opportunities.

We could help you out on a custom services basis? (We = <http://lefthook.com|Left Hook> or <http://IntegrationHelpers.com|IntegrationHelpers.com>)

I don’t think either CWise nor HubSpot will be building out a direct integration you can leverage.

What are you using currently do sync your contacts?
Maybe CC <@UKN05SLNR>
Also CC”ing in <@U016SR69FDF> to help me track

I’m not super up on all aspects of our api, one of our developer relations team members would know for sure.

If I recall, I don’t _think_ there’s really a thing for this yet? The closest I saw was using `Crm Extension Cards` to have a button that would allow one to open a link to this file.

That would mean hosting the file elsewhere of course, again not sure on the details, just trying to offer something lol
This functionality would be useful imo

Hey <@U014UPFSTNK> The network tab was leading you down the right path, but there is one more step from there. All files should be in the file manager, that will then return a file ID.  You can then plug that file ID into the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview|Engagements API > see the “attachments” field in the example JSON
Your timing is appropriate because we _just_ (as in minutes ago) released a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/files|newer version> of the file manager apis
Haha actually my timing is _because_ you just released that and I got the email
So, bueno!
Hope you’re ready for a flood of documents to be attached to stuff :joy:
So <@UFBNA9K9A> I take it the idea is to create a “note” engagement the same way the HS frontend does it?
I think we can _manage_ all those _files_ for you. ( bad dad joke)
Yes exactly

We are evaluating both BedRock Data (FormStack) and PieSync for the contact and company integrations, but are open to suggestions. I am a fan of PieSync but we have used BedRock in the past. I do not believe CW or HubSpot will be building these integrations, but I do know PieSync is evaluating it and asked me to submit a formal request.

Okay. Let me try to explain in more detail... let me know if you need more (I am sure I will leave stuff out). We use CW as a post-sales CRM. It houses our agreements, contact records, and procurement records (which are orders we place with Dell and Cisco, not deals we need to sync back to HubSpot). We are looking to use HubSpot for sales only. This is where our sales team would create a deal and associate it with a company. The deal would then sync back to CW as an opportunity in their sales starter module. We are trying to prevent duplication of entering a new deal. So if our sales person starts it in HubSpot, they don't also have to start it in the sales module in CW. We would want the company name and associated contacts in HubSpot to sync to CW when our sales person creates the deal in HubSpot.

The contacts and company records would be two-way sync between CW and HubSpot, which PieSync and Bedrock do just fine (we haven't selected which one we want to use yet). Neither of them syncs deals (HubSpot) to Opportunities (CW).
Thank you Walter. A separate HS Integration App?  How does it present itself to the user?  A CRM Card?
it's a completely separate website showing info that comes from HubSpot.

Oh interesting! Not to complicate things :slightly_smiling_face: but we know the PieSync team a little bit (as well as the Bedrock Data team), having looked at building Connectors for both. If you want to throw our name out there for helping, happy to talk with them about it!

But yeah either way, if neither platform fits, we’d be able to help on a custom basis
